As an aside not directly related to your question, you probably want to 
be building on 1.14.4, the latest official H1 release with many fixes 
since H1.14.1, if you prefer H1. (As someone doing custom development 
work, either the H1 SVN TRUNK or the H3 line might also be a suitable 
base... a little harder to configure but much more flexible for dropping 
in your own components.)

The steps you've followed -- making your JAR, adding a Processor.options 
file, and ensuring those are findable on the launch classpath -- only 
serve to add your new classes as options in the configuration 
user-interface. (Note that you don't even necessarily need to do a full 
local rebuild, though that may be helpful while integrating/debugging 
your new code. You just have to drop the final results where a Heritrix 
install can find them.)

To actually use the new classes in a crawl, you still need to change an 
existing crawl's configuration to use your classes rather than the 
defaults. I recommend doing this via the web user-interface until/unless 
you become familiar with the 'order.xml' format. If all the other steps 
have been followed properly, your new class(es) will appear in the 
drop-downs of the 'modules' configuration page.

- Gordon @ IA

On 2/3/11 10:28 PM, Dhake, Pankaj wrote:
>
>
> Hi ,
>
> I am trying to customize the Heritrix 1.14.1 crawler for my use and am
> trying to replace the format in which the crawled contents are stored. I
> have written the necessary WriterProcessor, WriterPool and Writer for my
> purpose. As the developerï¿½s manual mentions I have made a jar which
> includes my classes and the Processor.options file with my writer
> mentioned in it. However, even after incorporating this changes and
> after that building Heritrix 1.14.1 with maven 1.0.2, the crawler still
> continues to use the ARCWriterProcessor and stores in the .arc format.
>
> Seems like I am missing some step. Please let me know if someone has
> already built changes in Heritrix.
>
> Thanking You,
>
> Pankaj
>
>
>
>
